byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

abstract: Obama administration and Major League Baseball officials have been quietly designing system to allow Cuban baseball players to play for American teams; system would relieve players of secret, arduous journeys they have had to undergo in past and open new well of talent to MLB.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration and Major League Baseball have been quietly working to create a system that would end the arduous journey Cuban baseball players have been forced to endure, and open up a huge untapped fan base and a deep well of talent.

headline.main: U.S. and Cuba in Trade Talks, for Ballplayers to Be Named Later
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Cuba in Trade Talks, for Ballplayers to Be Named Later

snippet: The Obama administration and Major League Baseball have been quietly working to create a system that would end the arduous journey Cuban baseball players have been forced to endure, and open up a huge untapped fan base and a deep well of talent.
